Sure. Give me a sec..
<@U0DCXC37U> since we're not talking about care assist on Monday, what's our goal for a time we send out the docs to hand off
Anytime we want
before EOD

<@U0DCXC37U> Call went well. Would be great to set expectations that we are done with any more thinking/work come Monday. A few times they referred to "the next time we chat" and I just want to make sure it's clear that the UX handoff will be in a final delivery state on Monday (and not WIP). Per the discussion, my to-do items are: 
1) Create an intro to the UX documentation that explicitly calls out that this work is just a starting point. Especially relating to tech considerations, we are suggesting examples that will need to be expanded upon (and renaming the triggers section, "example triggers")
2) Ali is adding an annotation in her visual style guide about a collapsed card behavior we discussed
3) Ada does not give users an option to "opt" out of her when she introduces herself--they are automatically opted in. We didn't tie up all the loose ends around how she introduces herself, so I'm calling out that what we are saying is just a suggestion. 
<@U1S5GKTHQ> Does this align with what you saw the next steps to be?

<@U0XCJ372R|ali> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/ali/F59CM1BS7/care_assistant_visual_design___v1.sketch.zip|Care Assistant Visual Design | V1.sketch.zip> and commented: <@U0DCXC37U> this has ALL my screens for both mobile and desktop.

initial_comment.comment: <@U0DCXC37U> this has ALL my screens for both mobile and desktop.

text: <@U0DCXC37U> call went well. ET and writers are excited and ready to go. Kristin was some concerned about the fine line between friendly and friend. But Beezie and I worked that out and put together some examples that demonstrate where that line is actually positioned. I think it'll give her a better perspective. Everything is all good, people!

<@U0XJFPSRL> Yup, that’s spot on. As far as introduction of Ada, I think the consensus is:
- Ada introduces herself inside of a thread. The only action button is an “Ok” or “Got it” acknowledgement.
- Ada can be turned off in global app settings or via a shortcut in the thread view secondary menu.
- And one I’m not super sure about: Ada’s intro prompt is not retained in the thread.

The last one is up for debate. It didn’t seem that Kristin was sold on having the intro in a specific thread and if we can’t take action on that historic card, then might as well remove it. This exception is only for this intro card.
Another thing we didn’t fully flush out: collapsed view for an Ada prompt if it’s just one prompt. Is there a collapsed view at all? If so, what do we display.
Yea. I feel like there were a few things that we "didn't fully flush out"

Do you feel like you understand their expectations around these, <@U1S5GKTHQ>? Trying to figure out how much more I need to add in terms in new thinking to this UX documentation, or if I should just spend my time making sure I set up an intro to these documents as things that are "suggestions" and need more pushing on
I can't get a good read on what their position on this is

i think the suggestions was more about tech triggers and we should take a stab at defining the “up in the air” UX things a little more. happy to jump on a call to talk about those few outstanding thigns

<!here|@here> I have some swollen tonsils that are getting increasingly uncomfortable so I'm heading to a doctor's appt at 3:15 today. I'll be working from home afterwards and a bit on the weekend to get the UX documentation into a presentation format with updates that came from our working session. Megan and I are going to connect on Sunday so she can look through it and then I will post the final PDFs here. Please let me know if there's anything anyone wants to chat about in-person before I head out
oh no! good luck
charlesv: Thanks thanks
